resources.string: For the convenience of your surroundings, this sound will not be played unless handsfree is plugged in.
Please connect to the free open WiFI ElectriCity in order to start the guided tour. This app use the WiFi to identify which bus you are currently on.

The most convenient ticket for shorter stays is to buy a Tourist pass. These are available as 1-day or 3-day pass for each zones mentioned below and cost about the same as 3 one way tickets. 
 
In the public transport system in and around Gothenburg the type of ticket you need may vary. The most important thing to note is that the ticket system is divided into zones, each zone representing a geographical area in which a certain type of tickets are valid. 

Zones: 
Göteborg 
This zone includes the center of Gotheburg and most of Mölndal. 
 
Göteborg+ 
This zone includes the same as Göteborg as well as the neighbouring towns and cities, such as Partille, Ale and the archipelago. 
 
Göteborg++ 
This zone includes the same as Göteborg+ and towns further away from Gothenburg such as Kungsbacka, Kungälv, Lerum and Marstrand. 
 
Göteborg+++ 
This zone includes the same as Göteborg++ but even more towns such as Alingsås, Orust, Stenungsund and Tjörn. 
 
NOTE: This is not a complete list but the most important for visitors to Gothenburg. 
 
Children: 
If you are above 20 please note that you can bring up to 3 children (under the age of 20) free of charge on the same ticket.

Here you can find the basics of how public transport works in Gothenburg. 
1. Buy a ticket before you board. 
	Tickets are normally not sold onboard. Press the ticket icon in the map to see resellers. 
 
2. Show your ticket to the card reader on the vehicle each time you board. 
	Some ticket types also require you to show your ticket when you exit as well. 
 
3. Outside Gothenburg you enter through the front door and exit through the back doors of the bus. 
	In central Gothenburg you may enter from any door. This is OK in order to speed up boarding. 
 
4. Please let other people leave the vehicle before you board. 
	Stand to the left and right side of the door when they open. 
 
5. Keep the receipt of the ticket available throughout the trip. 
	Some transport partners, such as SJ trains, don't use card scanners but inspect you receipt instead. 
 
NOTE: Traveling without a valid ticket will result in a fine. Inspections are frequent. 
 
Västtrafik customer service: 0771 - 41 43 00. Press 1 for information in english.
